articles.headline: Pension Plan Sues Wal-Mart Officials Over Failures
articles.snippet: The lawsuit says current and former executives and board members breached their fiduciary duty in their handling of allegations involving a Mexican subsidiary.
articles.abstract: The lawsuit says current and former executives and board members breached their fiduciary duty in their handling of allegations involving a Mexican subsidiary.
articles.lead_paragraph: One of the nation’s largest pension plans filed a lawsuit Thursday accusing Wal-Mart’s leadership of breaching its fiduciary duty in connection with a bribery scandal at the retailer’s Mexican subsidiary.

articles.headline: For Craftsmen, Fragile Lifeline From Craigslist
articles.snippet: Largely excluded from the economic recovery, carpenters, electricians, plumbers and other construction workers are pleading for work on the online classified advertising site.
articles.abstract: Largely excluded from the economic recovery, carpenters, electricians, plumbers and other construction workers are pleading for work on the online classified advertising site.
articles.lead_paragraph: With few places to turn, construction workers have colonized Craigslist as the cyberspace equivalent of the street corner or the Home Depot parking lot.

articles.headline: U.S. Chose Better Path to Recovery
articles.snippet: American policy makers have made decisions in the last year that strengthened the nation’s economy, while their European counterparts have made costly missteps.
articles.abstract: American policy makers have made decisions in the last year that strengthened the nation’s economy, while their European counterparts have made costly missteps.
articles.lead_paragraph: Last summer, things looked bad on both sides of the Atlantic. There were fears of double-dip recessions, and stubbornly high unemployment rates. Stock markets swooned.

articles.headline: State Bonds in Jeopardy as Tobacco Cash Fades
articles.snippet: A handful of bonds backed by yearly payments from tobacco companies under a landmark settlement with 46 states are in the earliest stages of default, and more distress is expected.
articles.abstract: A handful of bonds backed by yearly payments from tobacco companies under a landmark settlement with 46 states are in the earliest stages of default, and more distress is expected.
articles.lead_paragraph: Steady declines in smoking, a big win for public health, are creating problems for municipal bond investors.

articles.headline: 4 Years Later, Race Is Still Issue for Some Voters
articles.snippet: Research suggests President Obama’s mixed-race heritage can still be a powerful factor in economically distressed regions with high proportions of white working-class residents.
articles.abstract: Research suggests President Obama’s mixed-race heritage can still be a powerful factor in economically distressed regions with high proportions of white working-class residents.
articles.lead_paragraph: STEUBENVILLE, Ohio — This is the land of die-hard Democrats — mill workers, coal miners and union members. They have voted party line for generations, forming a reliable constituency for just about any Democrat who decides to run for office.

articles.headline: Dissident’s Plea for Protection From China Deepens Crisis
articles.snippet: Facing criticism amid fraying relations with China, American officials privately acknowledged missteps in the handling of the Chinese dissident Chen Guangcheng.
articles.abstract: Facing criticism amid fraying relations with China, American officials privately acknowledged missteps in the handling of the Chinese dissident Chen Guangcheng.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Chinese dissident Chen Guangcheng’s abrupt reversal and plea for protection from the United States has deepened a diplomatic crisis and exposed the Obama administration to withering criticism that its diplomats miscalculated when they negotiated his departure from the American Embassy in Beijing.
articles.byline: By Mark Landler, Jane Perlez and Steven Lee Myers

articles.headline: U.S. Stresses Concessions From China
articles.snippet: For the first time, according to senior American officials, Chinese policy makers said they would commit to removing advantageous financing and regulatory conditions to state-owned enterprises.
articles.abstract: For the first time, according to senior American officials, Chinese policy makers said they would commit to removing advantageous financing and regulatory conditions to state-owned enterprises.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — American officials said early Friday that their annual summit meeting on strategic and economic issues with China had resulted in tangible economic concessions, despite the unprecedented diplomatic furor over a Chinese human-rights advocate seeking aid from American officials.

articles.headline: Nascent Deal Would Let Dissident From China Study in U.S.
articles.snippet: Chinese officials will allow Chen Guangcheng to travel to the United States with his family, American officials said, but Secretary of State Hillary Rodham Clinton cautioned that this case still unresolved.
articles.abstract: Chinese officials will allow Chen Guangcheng to travel to the United States with his family, American officials said, but Secretary of State Hillary Rodham Clinton cautioned that this case still unresolved.
articles.lead_paragraph: BEIJING — China and the United States reached a deal Friday that calls for the dissident Chen Guangcheng to travel to the United States with his family, in what appeared to be a resolution to an eight-day diplomatic crisis that had threatened to strain the relationship between the two countries and left the Obama administration open to attacks from human rights activists and political opponents at home.
articles.byline: By Jane Perlez and Michael Wines

articles.headline: Reasons Abound for Ebb in Job Growth
articles.snippet: Economists cited various possible factors behind the addition of only 115,000 jobs in April, but none are likely to comfort 13.7 million jobless workers.
articles.abstract: Economists cited various possible factors behind the addition of only 115,000 jobs in April, but none are likely to comfort 13.7 million jobless workers.
articles.lead_paragraph: The nation’s employers are creating jobs at less than half the pace they were when this year began, according to a government report released Friday.

articles.headline: How to Raise a Financial Wizard
articles.snippet: Several young authors of financial advice books say they were taught at an early age to be mindful about money.
articles.abstract: Several young authors of financial advice books say they were taught at an early age to be mindful about money.
articles.lead_paragraph: Though only a third of 2012 has passed, Zac Bissonnette is already a strong contender for the cheekiest author of the year award.
